discussion_comments.comment_body: URLs should be put in via description placeholders. You can also use markdown here

There's a discrepancy between this description and the documentation, which states
"Search terms to filter recipes, like name, ingredient, or category."
Have not tested yet to see which is accurate but they should match.

Right! Thank you for your comment! The documentation was a bit lacking on the whole search function, but I just found the underlying code in the mealie repo: https://github.com/mealie-recipes/mealie/blob/fb4aa2b7139749b8a80b1c1b64bac0e7f76e45c9/mealie/schema/_mealie/mealie_model.py#L158

So there is the story of if the backend is using postgresql the search is fuzzy, otherwise it isnt. 
But in general the search (fuzzy or not) is performed on all properties of the recipe and ordered by the distance of `the first searchable property`. That last part i have questions about, so is it only ordering on the name being the first property? Because that would mean if none of the recipes have a match on the first property the ordering will just be random instead of the next closest match on another property.

Allright, I updated both the documentation and description to be more concise, noting they search all the recipe properties. 

In the documentation I also added a note on the fuzzy or not behavior.
I did not realise this difference between DB version, I think your new descriptions will cater for any changes Mealie makes with this.

tankerkoenig uses the spelling "API-Key" in their documentation:
https://creativecommons.tankerkoenig.de/

                 "xy_value_template": "Defines a [template](https://www.home-assistant.io/docs/configuration/templating/#using-value-templates-with-mqtt) to extract the XY value."
               }

+              }

+                "min_temp": "The minimum target temperature that can be set.",
+                "precision": "The precision in degrees the thermostat is working at.",
+                "temp_step": "The target temperature step in degrees Celsius or Fahrenheit.",
+                "temperature_command_template": "The [template](https://www.home-assistant.io/docs/configuration/templating/#using-command-templates-with-mqtt) to render the payload to be sent to \"Temperature command topic\".",
+                "temperature_command_topic": "The MQTT topic to publish commands to change the climate target temperature. [Learn more.]({url}#temperature_command_topic)",
+                "temperature_high_command_template": "The [template](https://www.home-assistant.io/docs/configuration/templating/#using-command-templates-with-mqtt) to render the payload to be sent to \"Temperature high command topic\".",

discussion_comments.comment_body:
```suggestion
                "temperature_high_command_template": "A [template](https://www.home-assistant.io/docs/configuration/templating/#using-command-templates-with-mqtt) to compose the payload to be published at the temperature high command topic.",
```
